title: Teaching Your Child To Read: A Step By Step Guide To Helping Your Preschooler Learn And Develop Simple Reading Skills
features: Letters & words & sounds, oh my! Don’t panic, Mom… Kickstarting your child’s reading journey is WAY easier than it sounds.
Did you know that children in Finland don’t start school until they’re seven years old? Yet, they go on to become exceptional readers.
Why is that?

The reason is simple: in Finland, people understand that fostering a love of learning is the key to success. Therefore, they allow children to build up their foundational skills through play, conversation, and creativity --
before
enrolling them in formal education.
And as parents, we can learn from that.
We can’t change our children’s age to start school, but we can set them up for success by nurturing their early literacy skills and igniting an interest in learning.
The best part?
The learning process can be exceptionally good fun -- for parents as well as kids.

The idea of setting children up to be confident and fluent readers is daunting for most parents, but it really doesn’t need to involve formal lessons or an in-depth understanding of the curriculum… In fact, it shouldn’t.
The best way to
set your child on the path to becoming an enthusiastic, curious, and confident reader
is to integrate literacy skills into your everyday life... and above all, make them fun.
In
Teaching Your Child to Read
, you’ll find
a
modern and straightforward approach to teaching your child early reading skills.

Teaching your child to read isn’t as tricky as it sounds... and you already have all the skills you need to do it.

that parents, and teachers can use to scaffold their lessons. Without knowing what you are doing and where you are going, the process of teaching your child to read can be haphazard. You can use these valuable reference materials to maximize the effect of your learning sessions.
"Teaching Your Child to Read"

is the type of book you will want to keep handy, as it covers a wide range of developmental levels. Parents, early childcare staff, homeschoolers, and teachers will find a comprehensive review of the latest research along with tips and tricks and milestones to enhance the process of teaching children to read from babies right through to early grade school. This book summarizes many course materials all in one place. Included in the book are some reference materials. You will want to reread the chapters as you progress with your child through the various ages and stages of reading: from language development for infants to read-aloud sessions with toddlers to the
"read it to me"
stage.  One very significant chapter is
"Parent Pitfalls You Can Easily Avoid."

Knowing what not to do is just as valuable as knowing what to do. The pitfalls have very insightful advice about reading, but many also center around how to support your child through this challenging adventure gracefully.  This is a
"must-have guide"
for any individual who want to be intentional in their approach to teaching reading.★★★★★~ Rene Yapp, Early Years Educator

About the Author

Jayne Beacon believes that parents are the most important educators in a child's life. She has long been passionate about giving struggling parents the tools they need to help them raise curious, imaginative and creative children who go on to succeed in education and in life.Jayne understands that parenting is fraught with worries. Preparing small children for a bright future can feel an overwhelming responsibility! Jayne utilizes her extensive training and experience to support parents in meeting their child's natural development patterns during those crucial early years.Enthused about giving children the best start in life, Jayne offers practical activities and proven advice that will keep children engaged and enthusiastic whilst giving parents confidence in their own abilities to support their child's learning journey.In her free time, Jayne is an avid reader herself and she also enjoys writing about early years education. Jayne relishes her role as a full-time homemaker and loves spending as much time with her family as possible.
